A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Overall - thought it was pretty good. Johnson took the film on many directions that I didn't expect or that I had imagined they would have gone during the 2 year wait...and that's not a bad thing. Sure - it's not a perfect film. It's too long\, one or two scenes were totally unnecessary and only serves to give characters something to do that would have otherwise been sitting around. Did I expect more or different answers to questions left unanswered from TFA? Definitely - but perhaps better answers will come in future films. If not - who cares. It's just a movie and I was entertained.\n\nI've been trying to understand the low ratings and all I can figure is that folks didn't get the movie they had made in their heads over the past two years. Perhaps when they get the chance to write and direct a Star Wars movie - then they can do what they want -  it Rian Johnson made this his own\, sending the story off in new directions and I for one am excited to see where JK Abraham's takes it in Episode IX.
